instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: 820 3332 PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG shorted
threads.message: 820 3332 PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG shorted 0v, 0.085v resistance, heat sink gets hot enough to burn you while checking voltage. Is it safe in inject current into a GPU low volt line like that, or any advice as to sourcing out what causing the short? Machine powered with no video twice, booted normally once, then no power. No visible liquid damage...

threads.title: 820 3332 PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG shorted
threads.message:
Why do you post voltage (0.085V) when reffer to resistance?
Do you mean 0.085 in diode scale instead?
In such case, is not low value at all; injecting tension doesn't help then...
Post voltages for <CHIP>U8350</CHIP>.

threads.title: 820 3332 PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG shorted
threads.message: The usual <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. Did you mess with the board at all before it died? Does it still power on and chime?

threads.title: 820 3332 PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG shorted
threads.message: Yes, diode scale is what i am referring to.

threads.title: 820 3332 PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG shorted
threads.message: No power now, hit <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with some hot air, no change, should I replace, or just resolder...
